required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Clinical Outcomes After the Use of SYSTANE® HYDRATION
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Clinical Outcomes Following the Use of SYSTANE® HYDRATION in Subjects With Dry Eye

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare SYSTANE® HYDRATION to Hyabak 0.15% based on total ocular surface staining scores (TOSS) at Day 42.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects will first be dispensed preservative-free 0.9% saline eye drops (saline eye drops) to be used during the Run-in phase between Screening Visit and Day 0 (Visit 1). Subjects who qualify will be randomized in a 1:1 manner to receive either treatment with SYSTANE® HYDRATION Lubricant Eye Drops or Hyabak 0.15% Eye Drops.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Ocular Surface Staining (TOSS) Score at Day 42
primary_outcome.description: The TOSS score is a cumulative cornea and conjunctival staining score. After instilling ophthalmic dye in the eye, the investigator graded 3 areas of the ocular surface for dryness on a scale from 0 to 5, where 0=Absent and 5=Severe. The 3 scores were summed for a resultant overall 0-15 score. A more negative change value indicates greater efficacy. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in IDEEL Treatment Effectiveness Score at Day 42
secondary_outcome.description: The IDEEL is 10-question patient-reported outcome questionnaire that assesses the subject's general satisfaction with treatment use. A resultant overall 0-100 satisfaction score was calculated, with a higher score indicating greater satisfaction and less treatment-related bother.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in IDEEL Treatment Inconvenience Score at Day 42
secondary_outcome.description: The IDEEL is 10-question patient-reported outcome questionnaire that assesses the subject's general satisfaction with treatment use. A resultant overall 0-100 satisfaction score was calculated, with a higher score indicating greater satisfaction and less treatment-related bother.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Tear Film Break-up Time (TFBUT) at Day 42
secondary_outcome.description: TFBUT is defined as the time elapsed from the last blink until 1 or more dry spots appeared in the precorneal tear film. A longer tear film break-up time indicates a more stable tear film and may lead to improvement in dry eye symptoms. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: SYSTANE HYDRATION lubricant eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days
Hyabak 0.15% eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days

intervention.description: Preservative-free, one drop 4 times a day in each eye (run-in period)

overall_official.last_name: Global Trial Leader, Global Development Operations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 3 study centers located in Germany, 3 study centers located in France, 2 study centers located in the UK, and 2 study centers located in Spain.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 114 enrolled, 15 subjects were exited as screen failures prior to randomization. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects (99).

group.title: SYSTANE HYDRATION
group.description: SYSTANE HYDRATION lubricant eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days

group.title: Hyabak 0.15%
group.description: Hyabak 0.15% eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who were exposed to study drug (including the run-in therapy) (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: SYSTANE HYDRATION
group.description: SYSTANE HYDRATION lubricant eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days

group.title: Hyabak 0.15%
group.description: Hyabak 0.15% eye drops, 1 drop 4 times per day (QID) in each eye for 42 days

measure.title: Total Ocular Surface Staining (TOSS) Score
measure.description: The TOSS score is a cumulative cornea and conjunctival staining score. After instilling ophthalmic dye in the eye, the investigator graded 3 areas of the ocular surface for dryness on a scale from 0 to 5, where 0=Absent and 5=Severe. The 3 scores were summed for a resultant overall 0-15 score.
measure.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who received at least 1 dose of the randomized study drug (Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Analysis Set).

measure.title: IDEEL Treatment Score
measure.description: The IDEEL (Impact of dry eye on everyday life) is 10-question patient-reported outcome questionnaire that assesses the subject's general satisfaction with treatment use (Treatment Effectiveness and Treatment Inconvenience). A resultant overall 0-100 treatment satisfaction score was calculated separately for Treatment Effectiveness and Treatment Inconvenience, with higher scores indicating greater satisfaction and less treatment-related bother.
measure.population: ITT Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with non-missing response.

measure.title: Tear Film Break-up Time (TFBUT)
measure.description: TFBUT is defined as the time elapsed from the last blink until 1 or more dry spots appeared in the precorneal tear film.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Total Ocular Surface Staining (TOSS) Score at Day 42
outcome.description: The TOSS score is a cumulative cornea and conjunctival staining score. After instilling ophthalmic dye in the eye, the investigator graded 3 areas of the ocular surface for dryness on a scale from 0 to 5, where 0=Absent and 5=Severe. The 3 scores were summed for a resultant overall 0-15 score. A more negative change value indicates greater efficacy. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: ITT Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with non-missing response.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study (up to 63 days). AEs are reported as pretreatment and treatment-emergent.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject who was administered an investigational product regardless of whether or not the event had a causal relationship with the treatment. AEs were obtained through volunteered and elicited comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator.

group.title: Pretreatment
group.description: All subjects who consented to participate in the study prior to the initiation of study treatment

group.title: SYSTANE HYDRATION
group.description: All subjects treated with SYSTANE HYDRATION lubricant eye drops

group.title: Hyabak 0.15%
group.description: All subjects treated with Hyabak 0.15% eye drops

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: WW Medical Affairs Director, GMA Ophthalmics
